child.pub-comments: The author is not quite sure of Western Beboid's place in the Bantoid classification. That is why he has a question mark after it.

child.pub-comments: The author is unsure of Gbaya's place. He says "Gbaya is either Adamawa-linked or an independent branch of niger-Congo".
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)
Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Even though the author puts Ubangian along the same line with Adamawa, under Gur-Adamawa, he says it is not a group, and there is no evidence yet presented for a particular relation with Adamawa.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previously held views, the author says Tegem-Amira, with four other subgroups, is not really Kordofanian. He puts it directly under Niger-Congo, saying Kordofanian is not a group.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previously held views, the author says Heiban, with four other subgroups, is not really Kordofanian. He puts it directly under Niger-Congo, saying Kordofanian is not a group.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previously held views, the author says Kwaalak-Domurik, with four other subgroups, is not really Kordofanian. He puts it directly under Niger-Congo, saying Kordofanian is not a group.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previously held views, the author says talodi, with four other subgroups, is not really Kordofanian. He puts it directly under Niger-Congo, saying Kordofanian is not a group.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previously held views, the author says Rashad, with four other subgroups, is not really Kordofanian. He puts it directly under Niger-Congo, saying Kordofanian is not a group.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: The author is unsure of Defaka's place in the Ijoid subgroup. He says on page 2 that its membership remains problematic. "Defaka has numerous external cognates and might be an isolate or independent branch of Niger-Congo which has come under Ijọ influence".
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)
Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Contrary to previous treatments of Senufic languages as part of Gur, the author is quite sure that it is a coherent group, and that there is no strong argument for the previously held view.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)

child.pub-comments: Author says Bijogo was formerly assigned to Atlantic on geographical grounds, so it is hard to place.
child.publications: Blench, Roger. 2012. Niger-Congo: an alternative view. http://www.rogerblench.info/Language/Niger-Congo/General/NCgenOP.htm. (28 August, 2012.)
